text: I'm not getting these notifications for some reason, I'll look into seeing what restaurants might be up for it

text: Hi <@U0116DL92E9> - yes, bulk delivery of free food/groceries is actually the main initiative we are taking right now. We will be focusing on people in quarantine centers and others in government housing complexes and lower income communities. You can see the plan we have outlined <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1N0jsUGJDZJY49cRsC5gvDn9F528cKOjPXuThO0D5T40/edit?usp=sharing|here>.

elements.text: - yes, bulk delivery of free food/groceries is actually the main initiative we are taking right now. We will be focusing on people in quarantine centers and others in government housing complexes and lower income communities. You can see the plan we have outlined

text:
Hi *<!here>* - sorry for the lack of updates in here. Many of the conversations have been happening in direct messages, so I just wanted to update everyone else.

After yesterday's call with the grocery delivery partners, we figured that the partnership that I had imagined isn't the best way forward due to the complex legal/logistical/operational requirements. Instead, our team is suggesting that those delivery services all continue to work individually (or together, if they choose) and we will simply provide primarily marketing support. If anything arises that they need support with, we're happy to see what we can do as well. We will also still plan on raising funds to help subsidize delivery costs.

Instead of focusing our efforts there, we've decided to put our efforts towards helping those who are quarantined by providing free meals delivered to the quarantine/isolation centers and lower income families by delivering free groceries. We are looking into alternative methods of getting groceries (looking wholesale) and delivery (renting vans for bulk drop offs most likely). We figured that keeping these two initiatives separate would make the most sense.

You can see the new plan we have outlined <https://docs.google.com/document/d/1N0jsUGJDZJY49cRsC5gvDn9F528cKOjPXuThO0D5T40/edit?usp=sharing|here>.

text:
This is a great success— the document seems to both understand the capacity of the local condition/ market/ service providers, and offer a way for good information exchange. I’m especially interested to see which contacts we have in place regarding grant/ proposals. I’m guessing the likes of World Bank/ IMF/ Greater Tech Community. 

Let me know where you need most help <@U010B7Q6XE0>

text:
Thanks <@U010UM8QBQA>! <@U010A0P7EK1> deserves the praise for the organization around this new initiative.

<@U0107A7161E> is working on the grant/proposals side of things. In support of that, we're reaching out to  grocery suppliers to better understand the unit costs of what we'll need.

I have a call set up w/ the owner of Fresh Corner so hopefully I learn something from them/potentially partner with them

text: There are 5 supermarkets within 100m of me— Shoa, Fresh Corner, Friendship, Morningstar, and Ethio Supermarket. Let me know if we need to know the price of eggs or something.
